page.title: 05LEISURE ACTIVITIES
page.content: In Kingswood, there are lots of clubs and things to do in your spare time. Most of the clubs take place in the village hall, the upper schoolroom, the chapel or the church. The clubs that go on in the village hall are: Brownies, Guides, dance, toddlers and playgroup for young children, keep fit/aerobics, skittles, the Jubilee Club, bingo and jogging for adults. The Cricket and Football Clubs use the changing room next to the village hall but play on the playing field by the hall. The Abbey Players and Junior Abbey Players act out plays and pantomimes in the upper school room. The Chapel organises children's clubs where they play games and sing songs. There are also prayer meetings and bible studies for adults. There is a pub where people can go for a drink or meal.
